thread.title: Dayton International Airport picks winner for $6M project
thread.title_full: Dayton International Airport picks winner for $6M project

author: Joe Cogliano
title: Dayton International Airport picks winner for $6M project
text:
James E. Mahan Sunesis Construction Co. was the apparent low bidder for a project to rebuild the… more A West Chester company has landed a $6 million deal to improve parking at the Dayton International Airport . Sunesis Construction Co. was the apparent low bidder for a project to rebuild the long-term “blue” lot at the airport. Dayton City Commission is scheduled to approve the contract on Wednesday. Sunesis plans to partner with certified minority-owned businesses to complete at least 20 percent of the work. Dayton International Airport is gearing up to invest more than $38 million over the next two years in new infrastructure projects, which will bolster the city-owned facility and provide many opportunities for local companies and their subcontractors. ( Click here to read more). This latest award — and other recent contracts — shows that plan is gaining momentum. Sunesis is no stranger to working at the airport. It has won multiple contracts there over the last five years, but this latest appears to be the largest. Last week, the city awarded Dayton-based R.L. Fender Inc. a $4.1 million contract for the first phase of a new hangar project at the airport for PSA Airlines .
